New York City is known for having one of the most extensive and efficient public transportation systems in the United States. It is home to the iconic subway system, as well as buses, ferries, and commuter rails.

The New York City Subway is a rapid transit system owned by the City of New York and leased to the New York City Transit Authority, a subsidiary agency of the state-run Metropolitan Transportation Authority. It is the busiest rapid transit system in the United States, with 472 stations in operation.
